title: The Forest
notes:
The camera keeps moving down when using keyboard and mouse, it is possible to mitigate the issue by pressing the windows key and selecting the game window again, but that unpins the mouse cursor from the center of the screen, limiting the camera movement.
The game works flawlessly using a controller.

The game crashes upon quitting.

title: The Forest
notes: Games works fine tested Multiplayer. Framerate is a bit lower

notes: had to open the game in windowed mode, but can go in fullscreen when ingame

title: The Forest
notes: Works on highest Settings with around 40 FPS. Crash on quit, wineserver need a restart if you want to start again

title: The Forest
notes: Flawless

Mouse doesn't really work (going out of the game in back in again does NOT work too), but with a gamepad it is fine
Crashes on exit and doesn't start again until you reboot. You must use the command "killall -KILL TheForest.exe" to close The Forest
title: The Forest

notes: hangs on exit (needs to be killed manually), With Ryzen 7 CPU taskset -c 0,2,6,8,10,12 helps a lot, 40 vs 60 FPS, somehow with all cores enabled it nearly consumes all of them but performance is pretty bad then.
title: The Forest

notes: no problems after 1h

notes: Hangs on exit, procces must be killed. After some days playing multiplayer with friends, no errors at all.

notes: Hangs on exit. Procces must be killed. No errors at all after 2 weeks playing multiplayer with friends.

notes: performance great but when moving the mouse right the view also goes down and when up the view moves also right and controller doesn't work in the menus otherwise with a controller completely playable
title: The Forest

notes: Just after adding Xinput via winetricks and enabling it in the ingame settings, mouse works without errors. before it felt wrong
title: The Forest

notes: Starts directly out of the box. I only experienced some issues with semi-transparent trees. Also, after exiting the game, the game crashes. But besides that: Playable smoothly.
title: The Forest

notes: Mouse glitches to bottom right (Unity wide problem) - VR doesn't start at all. Otherwise seemingly playable
title: The Forest

notes:
Had to install xinput from winetricks and tweak some settings in game to make the mouse to kinda work.
Also had to run at lower graphics than i normaly would in Windows.
Sometimes i get very small lagspikes.
The game crashes when it exits too.
title: The Forest

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-33-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes:
No graphics glitches, but poor framerate (under 60 fps at all lowest 1080p, 36-40 fps at 1440p maxed)

Has a mouse bug, where your view slowly drifts to the lower right when doing any mouse action, including clicks and scrolling. This gets fixed by alt+entering twice, but then the pointer doesn't lock to the game, causing it to go out of the game window on multi-monitor setups.
title: The Forest

notes: hangs on exit (needs to be killed manually), With Ryzen 7 CPU taskset -c 0,2,6,8 to make it perform good. Somehow with all cores enabled it nearly consumes all of them but performance is pretty bad then. Mouse drifts a bit onto the bottom of the screen when turning. Mouse in crafting book drifts down even more. 2560x1440, allmost maxed, motion blur off, film grain off, FPS between 45-90. Mostly around 70
title: The Forest

notes: mouse glitch in desktop mode still there - VR now works, options menu cant be adjusted (I think this bug is not related to linux, it doesn't work on windows aswell) and can't exit options menu - game has to be killed. otherwise performance seems pretty bad, but that could be due to my hardare and not having the ability to change the graphics settings.
